description: ff. 29 (incomplete: several lacunae). 262 x 182; 187 x 122 mm. 27 lin. 13th cen. Fragment; perhaps the work of Ibn al-Najjār, d. 643/1245, cf. Brockelmann, GAL, I, 443; S I, 563. First complete entry (fol. 1a): Naṣr ibn Yaḥyá al-Kirmānī (fl. 588/1192). On fol. 11b begins bāb al-wāw with the biography of Wāthiq ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Anbārī. Bāb al-hāʼ commences on fol. 15b with Hādī ibn Ismāʻīl al-ḥasan. Last entry (fol. 29b): Hibat Allāh ibn al-ḥusayn ibn Yūsuf Abū al-Qāsim al-Asṭurlābī. Incip. (as extant): ... فقال کان شىخا حسنا ملىح المحاضرة حفظه للحکاىات
title: [Dhayl Tārīkh Baghdād].
subject: Baghdad (Iraq)—Biography—Early works to 1800
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
